intro: Erigeron sogdianus, commonly known as the Sogdian fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia, particularly found in regions of Kazakhstan and Tajikistan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Erigeron sogdianus is often found in mountainous areas, where it contributes to the local biodiversity and ecological balance.
